item.title: 27 Wilderton Road N16 Hackney Construction waste dumping., 11th August
item.description:
Concrete waste dumping on wilderton Road N16 Hackney, this spillage is from number 27 Wilderton Road N16 , construction site happening almost every day. Can Hackney council please clean. Drains have been blocked also contaminated soil left in Road.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Linthorpe Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Litter strewn all over street by Goodrich school, 11th August
item.description:
This is a problem that has occurred several times before. Litter has been taken from a bin in a blue plastic bag to be collected no doubt by your staff. Failure to collect it for days has meant foxes,rats etc have split it to get to discarded food. There is a similar problem on Underhill Road by Lew Evans Care Home. Leaving thin plastic bags containg discarded foods nappies etc to await collection is really a bad idea and the council needs to think of an alternativr
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Upland Road, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti on grey comms box in The Avenue next to junction with Southend Rd, Beckenham, 11th August
item.description:
Some graffiti appeared on the comms box here, outside Beckenham Court, 2 The Avenue, over the weekend. Please can it be removed - thanks!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Avenue, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous asbestos on allotment reported and closed with no action being taken, 11th August
item.description:
A large amount of asbestos has ben found on Grasmere Allotment Plot 15B after inspection. This is a potentially dangerous health and safety issue as the tenants of adjoining plots often have very young children with them. The Plot has been unattended for several years and it is believed that the asbestos originated from the previous owner, deceased for several years, of the property at Grasmere Road adjoining the plot who also was tenant of Plots 15A and 15B on the allotment for 40 or more years. This has been reported to the Council and to the Allotment Help Desk and Grounds Maintenance several times with no action being taken, no response other than acknowledgement from the Help Desk and NO HELP. THIS HAS BEEN REPORTED SEVERAL TIMES AND DESPITE BEING TOLD IT IS BEING DEALT WITH OR BEING ACTIONED NOTHING HAS BEEN DONE. THE MATTER KEEPS BEING CLOSED WITH NOTHING BEING DONE. THIS IS PREVENTING THE PLOT BEING TENANTED AND IS A LOSS OF REVENUE TO THE COUNCIL
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 61, Grasmere Road, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pet dog found deceased 1/8/25, 11th August
item.description:
Black and white pet dog found dead in disturbing circumstances with a deep neck wound and collar missing. Her collar has still not been found. She escaped from a garden on Birchwood road on the morning of 31/7/25 and was found deceased beside the rail lines on the morning 1/8/25 near Jubilee Park (between Petts wood and Bickley station) There have been incidents of people harming animals deliberately in the past in the area -mutilation of pet cats. This incident could therefore pose a threat to other animals and possibly to people as well.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tent Peg Lane, Petts Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Temporary Traffic Lights, 11th August
item.description:
The temporary traffic signals Red light near Clarence rd stuck on red. Has been all evening..police called..not their responsibility.. TFL emailed..not their responsibility. Please action. Causing horrendous noise pollution from all the cars and buses beeping constantly.. to all residents and is an immediate safety risk as cars are taking over the ques and speeding through the red lights risking crashing to oncoming traffic

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 112, High Street, Ponders End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous "crease" along road, 11th August
item.description:
Dangerous "crease" along road, at pedestrian crossing, opposite side to John Lewis. This afternoon a little girl who was crossing the road with her family in the direction of the arrow tripped on this "crease" and fell flat on her face. She was seemingly paying attention, but this road surface needs urgent treatment to ensure it is safe for pedestrians please. Before making any alterations please fully record current state of the road at this location including with measurements and photos so that today's incident can be cross-referenced with evidence if required.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 295, Oxford Street, Fitzrovia, Camden Town, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More bins or bigger bins required., 10th August
item.description:
Please can we have more litter bins and bigger litter bins like the one in the photograph. We have had a significant amount of increased footfall in Bromley Palace Park, more dog walkers and a lot more people having picnics. The bins are emptied regularly. Which is great, but unfortunately the bins are regularly overflowing now, so we could do with a couple more and big, fox proof ones please as we have seven mischievous foxes in the park. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Chase, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing Dog Waste Litter Bin, 10th August
item.description:
Scadbury Park Nature Reserve, Chislehurst: Via the Perry Street car park entrance heading towards The Green/St Paul’s Cray, please could you empty the public dog waste litter bin which is full and overflowing - as per the attached picture. I have personally reported many times over the years about this particular bin and feel it needs to be emptied more regularly please.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Drive, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin needs replacing for one which foxes can’t enter, 10th August
item.description:
Please can this bin be replaced with a large bin which is fox proof as I keep having to pick up all the rubbish that they dig out of it. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Chase, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet
